content:
Anthonys Arch Setup 1. Boot Into Arch and Run the Installer Create an Arch USB using Etcher or Ventoy. Boot the laptop from USB. When the terminal loads, run: archinstall Install Settings Here is what I did for these settings. Some are abvious and I&rsquo;m not trying to be condisending. Think of this section as a checklist
Archinstall language Select_language = &ldquo;English&rdquo;
Locales Keyboard_layout = &ldquo;us&rdquo; Locale_language = &rsquo;en_US.UTF-8&quot; Locale encoding = UTF-8
Mirrors and repositories Do nothing
Disk configuration Select &ldquo;Partitioning&rdquo; Then select &ldquo;Use a best-effort default partition layout&rdquo; Lelect the main hard drive
Swap Do nothing
Bootloader Bootloader = &ldquo;Grub&rdquo;
Hostname Hostname = &ldquo;anthopc&rdquo; // name this whatevery you want your pc name to be
Authentication Select &ldquo;Root password&rdquo; type a root password Select &ldquo;add new user&rdquo; Type a user name type password for that user
Profile Select …
title: Anthonys Arch Setup

content: Why do this I have found that my clients want lots of features on there site but don&rsquo;t want to pay the price for them. Fine I say, I&rsquo;ll set them up with wordpress and use the ocean of plugins to get them whatever they want without having to charge them the cost to make it myself. Clients also want to point at a pixel and say move a little to the left. Then they say, move it a little to to the right. Then they say a little to the left. They won&rsquo;t direct the design of the entire site but little things here and there, they will want to influence. The issue is that with wordpress, you are using a template and the little changes on a template are very annoying to modify. You have to dig though an ocean of files and many times, those files are not very well organized. Additionaly, what looks good on a site is a combonation of three things, good UX (= good visuals), basic visual sciology, think the color wheele and complimenting colors, and whatever is trendy in the world of …
